fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Creating a space with a long space key works but the space can't be deleted afterwards.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new space with a long space key (e.g. {{pACifiSwDbjc5xPCgVirK5s4hDfE4PLJXPJ1r15vTEkjJUPI6dqZV6cx5AfoqNsYLpzHUSmCgCSVSu6dLd2oAviqr9ZlqweFQiybJH9OD1spmGpFCHeqvTSLyMijRtqKm7OWJbHzZ7vDaJfxMUQd2ZdBh8NlvekrZBUoyCbH0bGA0H1YicCdL3knmOCpq2v1t4foB31hDqyVvoUV49MXIHJEs2HOZhNZFzruwCGCTWXpUsJdVnk1f9WunAr49Vw}}
 # Attempt to delete the spce

h3. Expected Results
The space can be deleted.

h3. Actual Results
The space can't be deleted and the UI shows the following error:
!image-2021-09-15-15-41-36-662.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

h3. Notes
The space creation is successful when using both the UI or the REST APIs.

*When using the UI*
The response is:
{code:java}
{"errorCode":500,"errorType":"UNKNOWN","errorMessage":"Transaction rolled back because it has been marked as rollback-only"}
{code}

*When using the {{/rest/api/space}} API*
The response is:
{code:java}
{"statusCode":500,"message":"org.springframework.dao.DataIntegrityViolationException: could not execute statement; SQL [n/a]; nested exception is org.hibernate.exception.DataException: could not execute statement"}
{code}
fields.summary: Creating a space with a long space key works but the space can't be deleted afterwards

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Currently space delete operation of large spaces often causes deadlocks, and since it's  not single transactional it leaves space data in inconsistent state. This needs to be fixed.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Import a space with large size eg. 40GB
 # Try to delete it from UI 

h3. Expected Results
It should be deleted without leaving anything in the database

h3. Actual Results
Even after several hours 17-18, it gets failed with timeout

h3. Workaround

Deletion from backend.
fields.summary: Redesign space delete operation so it doesn't time out or deadlocks

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Using [Google's Data Studio|https://datastudio.google.com/] to created a report/ dashboard, when embedding the dashboard into a Confluence page, using the native smart link feature, the dashboard will be embedded but some unnecessary blank space will be added to the bottom of the dashboard.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a report using [Google's Data Studio|https://datastudio.google.com/]
# Share the report with anyone with the link
# Enable embedding through *File* -> *Embed Report* and copy the embeddable link
# Paste the link into a Confluence page and set it to *Embed* view

h3. Expected Results
The report should be embedded without any space at the bottom, just like it is while editing it:
|  !data_studio.png|thumbnail! |

h3. Actual Results
Blank space is added below the dashboard's actual contents:
|  !confluence.png|thumbnail! |

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Embedding a data studio report adds unnecessary blank space at the bottom

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Error while a PDF exported page is opened using the default Adobe PDF Reader. Happens only when there is Traditional Chinese word “動” present on the page.
 Error: "Cannot extract the embedded font"

!image-2021-09-14-20-29-37-701.png|width=357,height=185!
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Step 1: Use Custom Font in the *PDF Export Language Support* section under General Configuration. Downloadable link: [Google Fonts|https://fonts.google.com/?subset=chinese-traditional] or [TrueType|https://www.moedict.tw/fonts/truetype/SourceHanSansTC/].
 # Step 2: Create and publish a page with the Chinese word “動” in the page content.
 # Step 3: Export the page to PDF format and download it.
 # Step 4: Open the download PDF file in default Adobe PDF Reader.

h3. Expected Results

The PDF file should open in default Adobe PDF Reader with the Chinese word “動” displayed.
h3. Actual Results

Error Pops-up in the default Adobe PDF reader and the contents in the file would not be visible.
h3. Workaround

Instead of the default Adobe PDF reader, use the pdf using a browser or any other PDF reader like Foxit reader.
fields.summary: Error when PDF exported page is opened in default Adobe PDF Reader

fields.description:
h3. Scenario:

When an image on the page is inserted within sections/layout a Horizontal scroll bar can be seen.
 # In blank page without section.
 ** Scroll Bar *does not exist*.
 # In page with only one section.
 ** The Image insert inside the section *will not have* a horizontal scroll bar exist.
 # In page with 2 sections.
 ** The Image insert inside the section *will have* a horizontal scroll bar exist.

Therefore, user prefer to have the image auto resize to fit into the sections instead of having the scroll bar below.
h3. Workaround: 

1) Either Zoom out the page within the browser

2) or edit and republish the page without any changes and the images render without a horizontal scroll bar, only till the page is refreshed.
fields.summary: Image does not auto resize when the page has more than one sections and a horizontal scroll bar exist under the image instead.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Jira issues when converted from legacy editor show as 'Data Card - Link' in the new editor
 The Jira issues are rendered properly in the new editor after conversion. However, this is causing issues with the 'Page Properties report' macro, where this Jira shows a normal link instead of a card. 
 However, if we replace this 'data link' (Jira issue converted from Legacy editor) as a Jira issue on the 'Page Property' macro. We are able to see the Jira issue as expected in Page Properties Report macro.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page in legacy editor
 # Add Page Property macro and add the Jira issue inside the table - (Page 1)
 # Create another page with Page Property Report macro - (Page 2)
 # The Jira issue on Page 2 looks as expected at the moment.
 # Convert Page 1 to the new editor.
 # Check Page 2 and now we'll see the Jira issue displayed as a normal URL, not a card.

h3. Expected Results

The 'Jira issue' in the legacy editor should get converted as a 'Jira issue' on the new editor.
h3. Actual Results

The 'Jira issue' in the legacy editor is getting converted to a 'Data card link' in the New editor.
h3. Workaround

Manually replace 'Data Card link' with a 'Jira issue' after converting Page 1 (Page containing Page Property macro). Now it shows as expected on Page 2 (Page containing Page Property Report macro).

Replacing multiple issues in multiple pages is not a viable solution and hence this issue needs to be addressed.
fields.summary: Jira issues when converted from legacy editor show as 'Data Card - Link' in the new editor, this affects Page Properties Report macro

fields.description:
_*This is impacting the Confluence Cloud for Slack app.*_
h3. Issue Summary

When a page title is modified, other pages and blogposts have an update WebHook triggered. The way apps know the reason for that change looking at the attribute *updatedTrigger*.

Example of usage:
{code:java}
// Link refactoring is triggered when
// links to a renamed or moved page or attachment are updated
// Details https://goo.gl/85zTNa
if (req.body.updateTrigger === 'link_refactoring') return true {code}
However, blogposts do not contain the same attribute. I'd guess it's just a matter of having two pieces of code that are similar and then applying the same logic used in page updates to blogpost updates.

As a consequence, this issue leads apps like Confluence Cloud for Slack to inadvertently post update notifications to users that get confused since such change is not displayed in the content history.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create page P
 # Create blogpost B containing a link to P
 # Setup WebHooks for a connect app (not sure about other types of WebHooks)
 # Rename page P or move it to a different space

h3. Expected Results

WebHook payload contains an attribute *updateTrigger* with value *link_refactoring*.
h3. Actual Results

Attribute *updateTrigger* is not present.
h3. Workaround

None so far.
fields.summary: Changing a page's title triggers update webhooks for blogposts linking that page without `updatedTrigger` atrribute

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When editing the page properties report macro you have the option to set _+columns to show+**_. However when you update this the columns appear blank after saving the change. This does not affect the title of the shown pages.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page that uses the page properties report macro
 # Edit the page
 # Edit the page properties report macro
 # For options click *show*
 # Locate _+columns to show+_
 # Enter _+columns to show+_
 # Save the macro confirugation

h3. Expected Results

It should show the data for the _+columns to show+_.
h3. Actual Results

The data for the list columns is not displayed.
h3. Workaround

Do not apply _+columns to show+_ in the configuration of the page properties report macro.
fields.summary: updating columns to show in page properties report macros removes data in columns

h3. Expected Results

Pageviews should get recorded for the homepage as well.
h3. Actual Results

Analytics shows incorrect page views for the site/space "homepage"
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior.
fields.summary: Analytics shows incorrect page views for the site/space "homepage"

fields.description:
h4. Summary

Content by user macro was intentionally removed as part of the [Confluence Cloud macros cleanup|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/we-re-cleaning-up-the-macro-browser-946028471.html]. 
{quote}Below you'll find a list of the macros that were intentionally excluded from the new editor and are being removed from the legacy editor along with the alternative methods you can use to get the same results.
{quote}
h4. Suggestion

Create a Content by User macro for the new editor.
h4. Workaround

From the macro cleanup article:

Create a normal link to a search for the author using the following link structure:

[https://site.atlassian.net/wiki/dosearchsite.action?cql=creator%3D%22USER-ID-HERE%22]

The user ID is obtained from the URL of the user's profile on admin.atlassian.com.

Example:

https://admin.atlassian.com/s/SITE_ID/users/USER_ID_HERE
fields.summary: Content by user macro for new editor

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

h3. Steps to Reproduce
*  Create few spaces with different categories
*  Go to the home page/page on one of the spaces and edit the page.
*  Insert space list macro and choose 'category' in scope
*  Publish the page and try changing the category to view the list. 


h3. Expected Results
We should be able to select the category and list the spaces as per the category.

h3. Actual Results
The macro doesn't show expected results or breaks the page.


h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior.
fields.summary: Space List macro not working as expected with category filter

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a user tries to view all administrators in the Space Settings >> Overview >> Administrators by clicking on the ellipsis(on the right corner) then we display the following error:

"We'll be back in a flash"
"We've encountered a small problem, but we should have it sorted out soon."

!image-2021-09-10-17-15-38-890.png|width=374,height=186!

 

The issue is intermittent and not always reproducible.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Step 1: Go to a Space.
 # Step 2: Navigate to Administrators under Space Settings >> Overview.
 # Step 3: Click on the ellipsis(on the right corner) to view all the administrators of the space.

h3. Expected Results
 * It should display the complete list of administrators of the space.

h3. Actual Results
 * It displays the following errors:
"We'll be back in a flash"
"We've encountered a small problem, but we should have it sorted out soon."

h3. Workaround

This happens because of the missing *confluence-administrators* group. If missing, creating a group with the name *confluence-administrators* and adding space administrators to it would fix the issue.
fields.summary: Space Administrators cannot be viewed under Space Settings >> Overview

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
We have been recently reported of an issue affecting the Confluence custom homepages. Sites that had a homepage are losing this info automatically, letting the default Confluence dashboard set up.
Sites that we try to set up a homepage don't apply the changes after saving them.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
*Case A*
If you had a custom homepage set, it got changed to the default Confluence dashboard with no action taken.

*Case B*
If you don't have a custom homepage:
# Go to *Settings > Further Configuration*;
# Edit it;
# Set up any space to be your homepage and then save it;
# Refresh the page.

h3. Expected Results
*Case A*
Your homepage is there.

*Case B*
The site gets a custom homepage set according to the changes you just applied.

h3. Actual Results
*Case A*
You may lose your homepage settings.

*Case B*
The changes don't take effect.


h3. Workaround
It seems the setting is being properly applied now. If you face this issue, change the setting back to the desired space and give it a few minutes so the change can take effect.
fields.summary: [SLO Bound] Custom site homepage changing to default dashboard automatically

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Image size increases when the page is exported in the PDF format

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page
 # Add an image to the page (let it remain in its original size)
# Publish the page
# Export the page as a PDF file 

h3. Expected Results
The size of the image should be its original size.

h3. Actual Results
Size of the image increases.

h3. Workaround
If the images are centrally aligned:
Resize the image. 


If the images are left-aligned:
1. Centre the image
2. Increase the size
3. Left align the image
4. Publish the page
fields.summary: Image size increases when the page is exported in the PDF format

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
 * When a user updates their timezone in their profile, the events in Team Calendar should update for their account, to show the event time according to their timezone. This is not happening, and the event time remains the same as before their timezone was updated.
 * Due to ID-7800, even though some users have a timezone manually configured in [the Atlassian account preferences|https://id.atlassian.com/manage-profile/account-preferences], when looking at the timezone of the profile in Confluence (via profile picture > *Settings* /  https://<SITE-NAME>.atlassian.net/wiki/users/viewmysettings.action), it shows "site default - UTC/GMT+0000). This causes the events to be displayed at the wrong time and/or day.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Log in as a user, and confirm that a time-zone value is set under the Account preference.
 ** [https://id.atlassian.com/manage-profile/account-preferences]
 # Confirm that the timezone on the site matches the time-zone above. (It should).
 ** https://<SITE-NAME>.atlassian.net/wiki/users/viewmysettings.action
 # Create a new calendar, and an event in the calendar, giving it a time.
 ** !time-zone-set.PNG|thumbnail!
 # Next, log in using another account, which has either a blank time-zone value or some other time-zone than the user who created the event.
 ** [https://id.atlassian.com/manage-profile/account-preferences]
 ** Note: If the time-zone value is blank in Account Preference, the time-zone on the site for the user will be set to "GMT+0000"
 # View the event that was created by the User in Step 3 above.|
 # The time of the event will be different, due to the differences in time-zone between these two users, and this is expected. (/)
 ** !time-zone-not-set.PNG|thumbnail!
 # Now, update the time-zone of the second user to match the time-zone of the first user, or some other time-zone, and view the event.
 # The time of the event does not get updates and remains the same as the time-zone of the user when the event was first created. (x)
 ** !time-zone-not-set.PNG|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results
 * When a user updates their timezone, the event time should get updated as well, to match their timezone.

h3. Actual Results
 * Event time remains the same despite the user's timezone being updated.
 * This is for new events as well, and no matter what, we cannot get the event times to sync between users.
 * For the root cause tied to ID-7800, events are displayed on a different day/time than is currently expected. For some users that have events set to "all day", it displays it on a different day by tapping the event. In this specific scenario, re-updating the timezone in 
 * [https://id.atlassian.com/manage-profile/account-preferences] might help after around 24 hours.

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Updating timezone does not update Team Calendar's event time

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

_*<User> doesn't have access*_ error message displayed for JSM portal customers when accessing Confluence KB space with unlicensed access enabled
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # From a JSM project: *Project settings->Knowledge Base*, link a KB space with _Restricted_ access. This enables all logged-in users (for this JSM project) to view articles in the space, without a Confluence license.
 # Add a customer to the JSM project. _*Ensure this customer is on an Atlassian account*_ and does not have any Confluence access.
 # Open an Incognito browser session and directly access any unrestricted page in the KB space.
 # On the login screen, enter the customer account credentials and continue. The following error message is displayed:
 !2021-09-08_10-25-28.png|thumbnail!
 # When you re-enter the URL, the KB page is displayed without any error.

h3. Expected Results
 * The page should be displayed immediately after entering the customer's account credentials.

h3. Actual Results
 * The "No access" error message is displayed after entering the customer's account credentials. To display the page, you need to re-enter the URL and press enter. Subsequent page accesses on this browser session work without any errors.

h3. Workaround
 * Re-enter the URL and press enter to access the page.
fields.summary: "Doesn't have access" error message displayed for JSM portal customers

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Following a deep link to an anchor will sometimes land on the wrong anchor.  

So far the wrong incorrect anchor has always been the first one in the destination page.

This frequency of occurrence varies from occasional to semi-frequent for different users.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create page 'A' with multiple anchor macros each with different names
 # Create a page 'B' with links to each of the anchors in page A
 # Follow a link from page 'B' to the first anchor in page 'A'
 # Click the browser back button (try doing so before the scrolling occurs)
 # Follow a link to the second anchor on page 'A'

h3. Expected Results

Page 'A' should load and scroll to the second anchor.
h3. Actual Results

Page 'A' occasionally scrolls to the first anchor.
h3. Workaround

Reload page or manually scroll to the desired target.
fields.summary: Following a deep link to an anchor will sometimes land on the wrong anchor

fields.description:
h3. Summary

As an administrator of Confluence, the [Audit logs|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/view-the-audit-log/] can be accessed in order to view changes such as the ones made at the [space permissions level|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/assign-space-permissions/].

However, some specific permission changes are not displayed. For example:
 * Changes to the *Default Space Permissions* session.
 * Permissions added to spaces when created. Only individual permissions for system app users are displayed.
 * Permissions that are added to a space when it gets imported from a different instance.

h3. Suggestion

This is a suggestion to have additional permissions added to the audit logs. This can help administrators with:
 * Confirmation as to when and who performed changes to the existing default permissions.
 * If a space already had specific permissions when created, which could help on identifying if a group of users could always see a space with confidential information, for example.
fields.summary: Additional permission details for the Audit Logs

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Upon deactivating and re-activating Confluence to [Reset and delete all data from the site|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloudkb/reset-and-delete-all-data-from-your-cloud-site-691012037.html], system apps responsible for existing add-on functions will not be re-installed/displayed at the *System* option of the *Manage apps* part of the instance.

This imposes issues like the following:
 * There will have no *Find new apps* session nor other options like *App requests* and *Promotions*. Those are generated by the internal EMCEE system app, providing a bundled version of the Marketplace channel.
 * Trying to manually access an URL for the *Find new apps* option will give a 404. For example:
{code:java}
https://INSTANCE.atlassian.net/wiki/plugins/servlet/ac/com.atlassian.confluence.emcee/discover#!/discover{code}

 * The [Slack integration with Confluence|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/use-slack-and-confluence-together/] will not work.
 * The integration with Microsoft teams will not work.
 * The integration with Trello will not work.
 * The Analytics app (for Premium sites) will not work.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

*Resetting the instance*
 # As a site admin, go to admin.atlassian.com and select the *View site bill* option for the instance to be deactivated.
 # On the sidebar, look for *Manage subscriptions*
 # Tap the ellipsis button on the right side of *Manage users* in the Confluence subscription panel.
 # Select *Delete* and proceed with the deletion process.
 # While on the same *Manage subscriptions* tab, tap the *Add more Atlassian products* link.
 # In the Confluence panel, tap *Reactivate* and wait for the process to finish.

*Managing apps*
 # Once the reactivation is done, go back to Confluence by tapping the *Go to Confluence* button available in the reactivation panel.
 # Tap the cog icon at the top right to go to the site administration.
 # Check the *Atlassian Marketplace* session on the sidebar.
 # For other issues, tap the *Manage apps* session, tap the *User-installed* dropdown and change it for *System*.

h3. Expected Results

Options like *Find new apps, Promotions*, and *App requests* should be displayed. In addition to that, system apps (I.E. Slack) should be displayed in the *System* tab:



!manage_only.png!
h3. Actual Results

The sessions are missing and there are no system apps.
h3. Workaround

Contact Atlassian support for the re-activation of the system apps.
fields.summary: Reactivating Confluence does not install the system apps back

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In the page tree quick actions menu, the following message appears any time one of the actions is disabled via permissions, regardless of current page restrictions.
{quote}There are restrictions on this page.
{quote}
!image-2021-09-07-17-29-28-350.png|width=145,height=248!

Those actions are:
 * Page edit
 * Page rename
 * Favorite a page
 * Get the link to a page
 * Copy a page
 * Move a page
 * Archive a page

If the current user doesn't have permission to perform one of those actions, they will see the message.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In Space Settings, remove Archive permissions from your test user.
 # You will see the error message when selecting a quick actions menu in the page tree (pictured above). (via [...] shortcut next to page title in sidebar)

h3. Suggestion

Clarify text in the quick actions menu that this is not related to Page Restrictions.
fields.summary: The restrictions message in Page Tree quick actions menu is misleading

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Copying/pasting lists within pages in Confluence loses all formatting.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a formatted list on a page in Confluence. Copy the list.
 # Paste the list into Confluence. It can be the same page or a different page.

h3. Expected Results

The formatting of the list is preserved.
h3. Actual Results

The formatting of the list is lost.
h3. Workaround

No known workaround.
fields.summary: Copy paste lists and media in Windows 10 loses formatting on paste

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Copying and pasting from an AWS support ticket correspondence (and specifically the manually authored portion) into the Editor removes all new lines.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to your AWS support center. (Go to Support > Support Center > choose any ticket that has a response in correspondence).
 # Copy and paste the content of that ticket into the Editor.

h3. Expected Results
 * Preserves new lines during copy/paste

h3. Actual Results

New lines are lost.
h3. Workaround

Paste text into a text file, and then copy and paste that into Confluence.
fields.summary: Copy paste from AWS support ticket correspondence to Editor removes new lines

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Links added to images will not work in the excerpt include macro

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page with an excerpt containing an image
# Add a link to the image
# Publish the page
# Create a new page and include the previously created Excerpt using include Excerpt
# Open the page that include the "excerpt include macro"
# Click the image

h3. Expected Results
It will redirect you to the page that you add on step2.

h3. Actual Results
It will just open the image.

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Links added to images will not work in the excerpt include macro

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently [Questions for Confluence|https://www.atlassian.com/software/confluence/questions] isn't available for anonymous users in the Cloud environment.
h3. Suggested Solution

Provide customers with the ability to open up the questions to anonymous users as per the Server / DC [solution|https://confluence.atlassian.com/questions/permissions-407724476.html].
fields.summary: Questions for Confluence for anonymous users

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When previewing a file in the legacy editor, using the *Upload a new version* to upload a new file may throw a "Your session has expired. You may need to re-submit the form or reload the page." error if the atl.xrsf.token is missing.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page in the legacy editor and upload a document file (pdf, docx, xlsx...)
# Publish the page
# Delete all the cookies and login again or delete only the atl.xrsf.token one through the browser's developer tools 
(!) (although this has happened naturally to some users, without the need to manually delete the cookies/ token)
# Open the file for preview and use the *Upload a new version* button to upload a new file

h3. Expected Results
It should successfully upload the file

h3. Actual Results
The following error might happen:
{quote}"Your session has expired. You may need to re-submit the form or reload the page."{quote} 
The following video better shows the issue happening:
 - [^session_expired.mp4]

h3. Workaround
The available workaround is to upload the file using drag-and-drop while viewing the page:
- [^workaround.mp4]
fields.summary: Upload a new version of a file in the legacy editor doesn't generate a new token

fields.description:
h3. Summary
[Moving pages|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/move-copy-and-hide-pages/] is something that is a great feature in Confluence, as it allows us to re-organize our content within the space and site.
Though we can undo a move we apply within the same space when dragging and dropping it on the page tree, we cannot do the same when using the Move page option to another space.

h3. Suggestion
* Implement the ability to undo the moving page action, letting the page back to where it was, with the children pages in under it.
fields.summary: Undo page moving

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Whenever an user needs to view an attachment with the "Attachment Macro", it will display one attachment, but at the same time the user is able to see all the attachments by arrow clicking to the right. This can could confuse users when passing pages.

h3. Suggested Resolution

Enable user to view only one attachment at a time. Either be able to control this option for a space or to make this change permanent.

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Display one attachment at a time

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Include Page Macro breaks if the page is copied to another space

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Page A and B.
 # Add 'Include Page Macro' to the page A and add the content on page B.
 # Copy the page A to another space.

h3. Expected Results
The Include Page Macro shouldn't break.

h3. Actual Results
The Inlude Page Macro breaks.
"*_Unable to render {include} The included page could not be found._*"

 !image-2021-09-06-16-31-21-457.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Workaround
Use Exceprt and Include except macro instead.
fields.summary: Include Page Macro breaks if the page is copied to another space

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Inserting a large image (for example, a long image with text) appears clear at first, but the image will have become pixelated after some time.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Attach the example image to a page, resize if you need to make sure it's legible.
 # Publish the page, confirm the text is clear, and wait a few minutes.

!insert-image.gif|width=500,height=325!
h3. Expected Results

The image resolution should not change upon page reload.
h3. Actual Results

Reload the page, and the text is blurred.

!after.png|width=499,height=361!
h3. Workaround

No current workaround. If you re-insert the image, it's clear again, but it only lasts for a few minutes.
fields.summary: Inserting large image on page results in blurred image

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The new Confluence editor has a regressions from the legacy editor in that it does not allow dynamic and static content macros marked as hidden to be edited.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install a dynamic content macro that is marked as hidden and has at least one parameter. For example: [https://dx-hidden-dynamic-content-macro.glitch.me/connect.json]
 # Create/edit a page and insert the macro.
 # Observe if the macro parameters can be edited (e.g. is the macro's pencil icon available).

h3. Expected Results

At step 3, the macro can be edited.
h3. Actual Results

At step 3, the macro can be NOT edited.
h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: Hidden dynamic and static content macros can not be edited in the new editor

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Site Export failing due to database inconsistency in page converted to blogpost

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page (*Page A*)
# As a child page of Page A, create a new page (*Page B*)
# Edit *Page B*, but do not publish the changes (that will create a draft *Page B draft*)
# Archive *Page B*
# Convert *Page A* to a blogpost
# Go to *Backup Manager* and try to create a new site export

h3. Expected Results
Export runs successfully.

h3. Actual Results
Export fails.

The below error is seen in the Backup Manager page:

{quote}
Export error

Unexpected error during export has occurred
But dont worry, well fix it for you!
You just need to contact Atlassian support and paste in this error message, timestamp and your instance details.
{quote}

h3. Workaround
Contact [Atlassian Support|https://support.atlassian.com] and mention this ticket's number *CONFCLOUD-72726*.
fields.summary: Site Export failing due to database inconsistency in page converted to blogpost

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

It would be extremely beneficial for a Space Admin to have the ability to use the admin key. For content that lives within the space the user is space admin on.
h3. Expected Results

Space Admin should be able to use the admin key to remove page restrictions for pages that live within the space they admin
h3. Actual Results

Space Admin do not have the ability to use the admin key
h3. Workaround

Have a *site admin* use the admin key when a space admin needs to use it.
fields.summary: Allow Space Admins to use the admin key

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using the recently improved [Tabs macro|https://docs.adaptavist.com/cfm4cs/latest/content-formatting-macros/tabs] from [Adaptavist's Content formatting macros|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/247/content-formatting-macros-for-confluence?tab=overview&hosting=cloud], if the content within the tabs consists of larger elements (I.E. larger tables with coloring, links, texts, and macros), it will load intermittently.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Make sure to have the [Adaptavist Content formatting macros|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/247/content-formatting-macros-for-confluence?tab=overview&hosting=cloud] installed.
 # Once it is installed, add multiple *Tabs* macro to a page (around 5 should be enough).
 # For each of the tabs, add a large amount of content. For example, tables with 200+ rows with some colored cells, text, links, and some macros.
 # Publish the page.

h3. Expected Results

The tabs should load, displaying all of their content.
h3. Actual Results

The results change when the page gets refreshed. For example:
 * No content is displayed where the macro is supposed to be.
 * The browser states that the page has become unresponsive.
 * A message stating that the "*App is not loading*" is displayed.
 * After a few refreshes, only some of the tabs get displayed.
 * After waiting for a long time, the content gets displayed, but the results are not always the same ones.

h3. Workaround

Split the content of the tabs into different pages or reduce the size of the added content for each tab.
fields.summary: The Tabs macro loads intermittently

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When viewing the file contents in the Media Viewer preview, if the file names are too long, it's not possible to drag the sidebar wider.
h3. Suggested Solution

Provide the ability to resize the sidebar. 

!image.png|width=515,height=279!
fields.summary: Ability to drag to resize media viewer preview sidebar

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

content-history.table.contributors incorrect for half of languages
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Change language to Gerson ( eg) 
 # Open the page history

h3. Expected Results

Changed by column should be there in correct translation
h3. Actual Results

There are two comment columns under pae history instead of 'changed by'
h3. Workaround

Change the language to english
fields.summary: content-history.table.contributors incorrect for half of languages

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

While browsing the [labels|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/use-labels-to-organize-your-content/#Uselabelstoorganizepagesandattachments-Browselabels] and [attachments|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/manage-uploaded-files/#View-all-attached-files-in-a-space] pages, to find pages using a single label or to list attachments in a Space, the pagination is not working.

By tapping the pagination numbers, although the pagination number changes (on the bottom of the screen), the results will be the same.

(i) Tapping the "Next" or "Prev" buttons work, properly redirecting the user to the next list of pages.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have a good number of pages using a specific label or several attachments (so it will trigger the pagination option):
 # Tap one of the page numbers
 !tap-1.png|thumbnail!
 # Tap another page number and see that the labels/attachments list remains the same - although the pagination number did change
 !tap-2.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results

The user should be redirected to the next page, including a different list of labels/attachments.
h3. Actual Results

Although the pagination number changes, the same pages/attachments are displayed.
h3. Workaround
 * Tap the *Next* or *Prev* buttons, instead of tapping the pagination numbers, to navigate to a different list of labels/attachments. 
 * Copy the cursor parameter from the *Prev* or *next* URLs if there is a need to use the link.
fields.summary: When I tap the pagination numbers on the "labels" or "attachments" pages, the list remains the same

fields.description: Pressing Ctrl/Cmd-K allows me to create new links, but if I press Ctrl/Cmd-K when a link is selected, nothing happens. So far, the only way I've found to edit a link is using the mouse.
fields.summary: Ctrl/Cmd-K should open "Edit link" if a link is selected

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Upon [adding a calendar|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/create-add-and-edit-calendars/] to the *My Calendars* page  ([https://instance.atlassian.net/wiki/mycalendar]), if the user is not the owner of the calendar and selects *Delete Calendar* instead of the *Remove from my calendars* option, it will only remove the calendar from the "My Calendars" page.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have user A creating a calendar.
 # As User B, select *Apps* on the top navigation bar and then, *Calendars*
 # There, tap the *+* icon or the *Add existing calendars* option to add the created calendar.
 # With the calendar added, tap the ellipsis button at the right side of the calendar's name and select *Delete Calendar* (instead of *Remove from my calendars*)
 # Confirm the deletion

h3. Expected Results

The original calendar should be deleted, making it not available for any sources retrieving it.
h3. Actual Results

The calendar is not deleted. It is still added to the original space and any other spaces having it added.

(i) If the owner/admin attempts the same process, it completely will delete the calendar.
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Deleting a calendar from the "My Calendars" page will not delete it if the user is not the author

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a user attempts to [delete a calendar|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/delete-or-remove-a-calendar/] that has its editing restricted or from a space that the view permission has been revoked, upon trying to confirm the calendar deletion, an error message is displayed instead of notifying the user that they do not have permission to do so:

!wrong_deletion.png|thumbnail!
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # As User A, create a calendar and restrict its editing to include only you
 # As User B, access this calendar under the space that it was added or any other location where the calendar will be added as well
 # As User B, tap the ellipsis button at the right side of the calendar's name and select *Delete Calendar*
 # Confirm the deletion by tapping the red *Delete* button

(i) Removing the user from the space's permission while the user keeps the browser tab open, without refreshing it (making the viewing of the calendar still available) can be also used as a test to confirm the error message.
h3. Expected Results

A message stating that the user cannot delete the calendar should be displayed.
h3. Actual Results

The following error message is displayed:
{quote}*Something went wrong.*
 Please try again later.
{quote}
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Erroneous message when attempting to delete a restricted calendar

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

According to the [deletion article for Team Calendars|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/delete-or-remove-a-calendar/], only the calendar's owner (and admins, if the configuration to do so is checked) should be able to delete the created calendar:
{quote}If you're using Confluence Cloud, and you'd like Atlassian Cloud site admins to be able to delete calendars, in addition to the calendar's owner, you can enable that option in your Team Calendars settings.
{quote}
However, any end user can delete the calendar if they have permission to view it.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # As user A, create a calendar
 # As user B, under the *My calendars* or a different space and then, select the option to *Add existing calendar* by pointing to the recently created calendar
 # After having the calendar added, tap the ellipsis button at the right side of the added calendar in the sidebar
 # There, look for the *Delete calendar* option on the dropdown
 # Confirm the calendar deletion

h3. Expected Results

The user should not be able to delete the calendar nor see the option to do so.
h3. Actual Results

The user can delete the original calendar even if it belongs to a different owner and space.
h3. Workaround

As the calendar owner, [restrict its editing|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/restrict-a-calendar/]. Although the user will be able to see the option to delete the calendar, upon trying to do so, an error message will be displayed:
{quote}*Something went wrong.*
Please try again later.
{quote}
fields.summary: Users are able to delete calendars not owned by them

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

According to the [deletion article for Team Calendars|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/delete-or-remove-a-calendar/], there is an option to allow site admins to delete calendars in addition to the calendar's owner:
{quote}If you're using Confluence Cloud, and you'd like Atlassian Cloud site admins to be able to delete calendars, in addition to the calendar's owner, you can enable that option in your Team Calendars settings. Type *Team Calendars* in the Confluence quick search to get to your Team Calendars settings, then tick *Allow site administrators to manage calendars*.
{quote}
Upon checking this option, end users are still able to delete the calendar.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # As an administrator of Confluence, tap the cog icon at the top right (which will redirect the user to the administration) and select *Team* *Calendars* on the sidebar.
 # There, check the *Allow site administrators to manage calendars* option.
 # Have the same user creating a calendar.
 # Now, with user B (non-admin) access this calendar in a space or add it into a different space.
 # As the end-user, tap the ellipsis button at the right side of the added calendar in the sidebar
 # There, look for *Delete calendar*

h3. Expected Results

The end-user should not be able to delete the calendar nor see the option to do so.
h3. Actual Results

The end-user can delete the original calendar, despite not being an administrator or its owner.
h3. Workaround

As the calendar owner, [restrict its editing|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/restrict-a-calendar/]. Although the user will be able to see the option to delete the calendar, upon trying to do so, an error message will be displayed:
{quote}*Something went wrong.*
 Please try again later.
{quote}
fields.summary: "Allow site administrators to manage calendars" configuration does not work

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When working with a Work Management project, it has a great feature called Timeline, which allows us to see a kind of roadmap of our issues and pending tasks for that project.
It would be great to have a way to dynamically embed a timeline in Confluence pages, so we can create great report pages of our project.

h3. Suggestion
As well as there is there is the [JIRA Roadmap macro|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/insert-the-jira-roadmap-macro/] for Software projects, it would be great to have a JIRA Timeline macro for work mangement projects, as a kind of feature pairity of the products.
fields.summary: JIRA timeline macro

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When there is a connect space and the space has pages, if the user has permission to view all, but no permission to add pages, the correct screen should be Project pages with disabled template sidebar. But right now we are showing “Space not found“ screen with a disabled template sidebar.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Enable Jira pages and connect to a space
 # Give user *View All* permission only on the space
 # Navigate to the Jira pages section.

h3. Expected Results

Users should be able to see confluence pages.

h3. Actual Results

User seeing following error:
 !Screenshot 2021-09-02 at 09.37.54.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Users should be able to view Project pages when "View all" permission is on in connected space

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When editing a page and changing only the title, by visiting the [Page history|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/create-edit-and-publish-a-page/#Create-edit-andpublish-Pageversionsandhistory] and reverting a page to the previous version, the title will not be reverted.

(i) The diff/compare function between the versions where only the title changed only shows a blank page as well.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Edit a page and change only its title
# Publish the page
# Tap the ellipsis button at the top right and select *Page History*
# Tap *Restore* on the right side of the version that had the previous title

h3. Expected Results

The title should be reverted.

h3. Actual Results

No changes happen. Although the page gets reverted, the title is still the last published one.

h3. Workaround
Publish the page with a version comment indicating that the title has changed.
fields.summary: Restoring a previous version of the page will not revert its title

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Adding a GitHub link to a repository in Confluence gets resolved correctly but Confluence is not able to authenticate GitHub link to a subdirectory. 
h3. How To Replicate  
 # Add a link to a private repo in Confluence and add a link to a subdirectory.
 # If you haven't authorised yet, the link will show "Connect to Preview".
 # Click on "Connect to Preview" and "Authorise Atlassian".
!image-2021-09-01-17-00-35-996.png|width=184,height=249!
 # The link to the repo will resolve correctly but the link to the subdirectory will show "Can't find link".
 !image-2021-09-01-16-59-35-854.png|width=406,height=107!

h3. Suggested Solution

Confluence should resolve the GitHub link to a subdirectory, the same way it resolves the GitHub link to a repository.
h3. Workaround

No workaround is currently available.
fields.summary: GitHub link to subdirectory shows "Can't find link"

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When inserting a table on the Legacy editor, the first column text will be no longer have the indentation to the left by default, where it was not the previous behavior.
 It does not happen on the other columns.
 This behavior can only be seen after publishing the page, in Edit mode, the text displays normally on the table.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Make sure to have the Legacy editor
 # Create a new blank page
 # Search for Legacy editor template
 # Insert a table with at least 2 or 3 columns
 # Add text on all columns
 # Publish the page

h3. Expected Results

Text is displayed normally, like the other columns, and seen on edit mode.
h3. Actual Results

Text does not contain the left indentation
 This behavior can only be seen after publishing the page, in Edit mode, the text displays normally on the table.
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
 Aligning the text from the first column to the center could be an option, although not ideal.
fields.summary: Table text on the Legacy editor page no longer have the left indentation on the first column

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Even with the *export* space permissions, if a user is not a site-admin, trying to download the successfully generated space export till fail with a *403 – Forbidden* error message

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Give a non site-admin user *export* permissions in a space
# Let the user export that space and try to download the export

h3. Expected Results
The user should be able to download the space export

h3. Actual Results
The user can generate the export but can't download it:
 !image-2021-08-31-14-35-21-649.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Add the user to the *site-admins* group or ask any site-admin to download the space export.
fields.summary: Non site-admins receive 403 – Forbidden when trying to download a space export

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In Microsoft Edge, the improved copy-paste feature fails to copy formatted text and pastes clipboard contents as plain text.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Microsoft Edge with improved copy-paste feature.
 # Create a test page in Confluence with some formatted text (e.g., bullet points, text links, attached images, etc.)
 # Copy the section of the text, and attempt to paste it into the same page.

h3. Expected Results

Clipboard contents should match the copied formatting.
h3. Actual Results

Contents pasted are plain text; stripping the formatting.
h3. Workaround

Change the default behavior to Link: [Improved copy and paste of URLs in Microsoft Edge|https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-edge/improved-copy-and-paste-of-urls-in-microsoft-edge-d3bd3956-603a-0033-1fbc-9588a30645b4].
fields.summary: Microsoft Edge improved copy/paste feature loses formatting and pastes as plain text

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The public confluence Page (with Page tree Macro) does not open properly when accessed as JSD customer

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a JIRA project and link it with Confluence Public Space.
# On any Concluence page (let say 'A'), add Page Tree macro to add child pages' links (let say Page B and Page C).
# Now, add some user as the JSD project customer/user (consuming no product license).
# When the use will access JSD article of page A. 
# Clicks any other Page's link i.e. Page B or Page C.
# The pages will not open properly but with errors, no page tree loading, and the upper menu bar is missing.

*OR*

# Create a JIRA project and link it with Confluence Public Space.
# Access JSD(any article or help center) as a customer.
# Now, on the same browser access Public Space that is linked with the JSD.
# The pages on the Public Space won't load properly and give errors.

h3. Expected Results
The page should open up properly.

Note: If you can't replicate it, try in incognito mode. 

h3. Actual Results
The Page tree doesn't load well. It has errors, no page tree loading, and the upper menu bar is missing.
 !image-2021-08-31-16-09-58-813.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
No workaround as of now.
fields.summary: Public confluence Page does not open properly when accessed as JSD customer

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Anonymous user not able to view Gliffy Diagram.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install Gliffy Diagram
 # Create a space with anonymous access
 # Add a gliffy diagram to the page
 # Access the page as anonymous user

h3. Expected Results

Anonymous user should be able to see the diagram.

h3. Actual Results

Anonymous user seeing *Internal server* error in the gliffy placeholder.

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Gliffy diagram not displaying for Anonymous User

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Confluence adds the Microsoft Teams for Confluence Cloud admin permission by default, even if admin disableds the Teams app functionality.

!image-2021-08-31-11-20-41-978.png|width=410,height=179!

From * .atlassian.net/wiki/plugins/servlet/ac/msteams-confluence/addon-config-page

!image-2021-08-31-11-22-30-489.png|width=451,height=103!

It's confusing for admins to see this new admin permission when they didn't enable the app.
h3. Suggestion

Enable the permission only when the Teams app is enabled.
fields.summary: Add Microsoft Teams for Confluence Cloud admin permission only when Teams app is enabled

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Using Chrome on Linux, the Jira Roadmap macro will get blurry.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a roadmap on Jira and copy its link
# Create a Confluence page, paste the roadmap link and publish the page
# Open the page in Chrome on Linux

h3. Expected Results
The roadmap should not be blurry

h3. Actual Results
The roadmap gets blurry
||Chrome|  !jira-roadmap_Chrome.png|thumbnail!  |
||FIrefox|  !jira-roadmap_Chrome.png|thumbnail! |

h3. Workaround
 Currently the available workaround is to use a different browser, such as Firefox.
fields.summary: Jira roadmap macro gets blurry when using Chrome on Linux

fields.description:
h3. Current Scenario

Confluence Cloud Premium allows customers to implement [IP Allowlisting|https://support.atlassian.com/security-and-access-policies/docs/specify-ip-addresses-for-product-access/] on the site level - a really useful way to secure access to your site.
h3. Proposed Solution

Some admins would like to implement IP Allowlisting on a specific Space, without affecting the rest of the site. This would be useful when intending to share some pages with a small audience, as you wouldn't need to implement the functionality on the entire site, and therefore include all your users on the allowlist.
fields.summary: Provide the ability to implement IP Allowlist on a Space level

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Label list macro does not show results when currents space is selected

h3. Steps to Reproduce
1. Add a label to one page
2. add label list macro on another page or same page.
3. select *Current space* in Restrict to this Space Key field.

h3. Expected Results
It should show the labels from current space.

h3. Actual Results
It does not show any result

h3. Workaround
Instead of filling the space field as "current space", select the actual space name in the field.
fields.summary: label list macro does not show results when current space is selected

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Microsoft Edge, the New copy-paste feature intermittently fails to paste web Link as Hyperlinks.
the Links gets pasted as URL Example: https://www.atlassian.com/
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # copy a link 
 # Paste the copied link using CRT+V 
 # the web link sometimes gets pasted as a URL

h3. Expected Results

The pasted links should always show up as hyperlink/smartlinks
h3. Actual Results

The pasted web links appear as a URL Example: https://www.atlassian.com/
{noformat}
...
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Set the Edge default copy-paste behaviour to Link 
 # In Microsoft Edge, select *More* , and then select *Settings* .

 # Under Settings, select *Share, Copy & Paste*.

 # Under *Share, Copy & Paste*, select the default option you want: *Link*, to paste the URL as a hyperlinked title, or *Plain text*, to paste the URL as a web address.
fields.summary: Microsoft Edge, the New copy paste feature intermittently fails to paste web Link as Hyperlinks

fields.description:
When using Confluence (Jira has the sam problem and an issue) to document facts this often needs refrencing urls.

Converting urls into smart link causes several problems
 * fetching an url is not side effekt free. fetching many url every time a page is edited can and often enough does cause unwanted side effects when developing it systems
 * most of the time the current implementation of the "smart link" processing is pretty dumb and looses important information in the process making the look "smart"
 * the ctrl Z approach does not help for pasted collection of links
 * the editor seems to have problems handling the "smart links", sometimes it only offers the possibility to convert as single link to an url, sometimes it only offers to edit the generated "smart" text - then one needs to copy annd paste the url.    

Additionaly "smart links" make the edit and save slow to very slow. Afair there is an issue that for pages with many links the "smart link" behaviour makes editing impossible due to the fetching all sites delay -> "!smart" breaks editing.   

 

When I paste a prepared text with say 30 links (happens often enough) the click every singe link, click edit link, mark url, copy url, mark text, paste url takes say 20 seconds -> 10 minutes correcting "smart".

 

It would be helpful to make it possible to disable "smart link" behaviour for a user or a workspace. 

 

This problem could be circumvented for some part if proper markdown and/or asciidoc import/export was there.
fields.summary: Option to disable "smart links" and means revert "smart links" to url

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Having a page with a Panel macro, if we put a calendar macro inside the panel, the calendar will load in edit mode but not while viewing the page, it will display an infinite spinner.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page in the legacy editor and add a panel macro 
# Add a calendar macro inside the panel
# Publish the page, edit it and convert it to the new editor
# Insert a calendar macro inside and set a valid calendar
# The calendar should load
# Publish the page

h3. Expected Results
The calendar should load 

h3. Actual Results
An infinite spinner is shown :
||Edit mode| !image-2021-08-27-21-38-16-761.png|thumbnail! |
||View mode| !image-2021-08-27-21-38-21-960.png|thumbnail! |

h3. Workaround
* Move the calendar macro to outside of the panel 
* or revert the page to a previous version, before it being converted to the new editor, through the [page history|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/create-edit-and-publish-a-page/#Create-edit-andpublish-Pageversionsandhistorypage].
fields.summary: Calendar macro doesn't load inside of a panel macro

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Team calendars allow you to add restrictions to a calendar, so that only the proper users can see/edit it. However, it is not possible to grant edit + view restriction for the same user. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a calendar.
 # Set the restrictions to *Only specific people can view or edit*
 # Add your account.
 # Set the restriction to *Edit*.

h3. Expected Results

As it happens with page restrictions, the calendar should be restricted that *no one can see it,* *and only you can edit.*
h3. Actual Results

Only the edit restriction was granted to you - the calendar doesn't have any view restrictions. You need to apply at least 1 view restriction for the calendar to be restricted.
h3. Workaround

Grant view restriction to a group you are part of. This way you'll have view restriction from the group + edit restriction that is being granted individually.
fields.summary: Unable to grant view and edit restrictions to the same user for a Calendar

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When [copying a page|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/move-copy-and-hide-pages/] (and its children pages), even even though the *Cancel* button is tapped during the process, the pages will still be copied to the destination.

(i) If the pages have attachments, it will also notify [watchers of the space|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/watch-pages-spaces-and-blogs/] that attachments were added to pages in the space, which could cause confusion.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# As an administrator, add a watcher to Space B (the user can also do it without admin actions if needed).
# On Space A, copy a page (with a couple of child pages so it can be easier to tap the *Cancel* button) and select the Space B as the location.
# Tap the cancel button (this can be done quickly as well, without seeing the percentage of the process)

h3. Expected Results

The pages shouldn't be copied.

h3. Actual Results

All pages are copied and if they have attachments, will trigger notifications about the attachments being added.

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Cancelling a copy process will still copy the page(s)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The Code Block macro can be configured to be collapsible when in the Legacy Editor. However, sometimes the *expand source button* doesn't show up and users are unable to see the content in the macro.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page using the Legacy template
# Add the Code Block macro.
# Make it collapsible.
# Access the page several times until the *expand source button* will stop showing up.

h3. Expected Results
The expand source button should appear.

h3. Actual Results

The expand source button doesn't appear.

h3. Workaround

Users can convert the pages to the new editor and put the code block inside the *Expand macro*.
fields.summary: Expand Source button in Code Block macro sometimes doesn't appear in the Legacy Editor

fields.description: If a link to a page is present in Page Properties it correctly shows the name of the page, but the Page Properties Report doesn't but shows the URL..._not sure if this is a bug_
fields.summary: Page Properties Report with internal Confluence links are not displayed with the page name

fields.description: The options to select what columns to show on the Page Properties Report is fine, but when a new column is added it requires all Reports to be updated that want to show it, might be a nice feature to exclude the columns what we don't want so others appear automatically
fields.summary: Page Properties Report define what columns not to show

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
 * Batched emails received after 5 hours

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # make sure you are watching a target page
 # Make any changes on this page through another account

h3. Expected Results
 * user should receive email notification immediately after the actual event 

h3. Actual Results
 * Email notification on this page edit arrives to the watcher with big delay (after 4.5 hours or more)
 * Email are being delivered even with 5 days of delay 

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Batched notification emails are delayed by hours and sometimes days

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

With the recent implementation of CONFCLOUD-30161, users that are added to the Instance _userbase_ but don't have a Confluence license are able to access content that is available to Anonymous users.

However, in case these users access Confluence while logged out of their accounts, and try to authenticate using the Log in option from Confluence, they will face an error message.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Make sure you have enabled Anonymous access on your Confluence Cloud Instance.
 # Add a test user to the Instance, but don't grant Confluence product access.
 # Access Confluence using the incognito mode on the browser. Content will load since Anon access is enabled.
 # Click on the log in option on the top right corner.
 # Log in to the test user.

h3. Expected Results

Authentication should work and the user should be redirected to Confluence.
h3. Actual Results

Below error is displayed:

!image-2021-08-26-17-38-03-059.png!
h3. Workaround

Access the Instance URL again - you will be authenticated, and your access will work.
fields.summary: Users are unable to authenticate to the Instance even though Anonymous Access is enabled

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Is a JSM project has 3 Confluence KBs linked to the project. With 2 KBs having Private view permission and the other has restricted view permissions. An unlicensed Confluence user who is a JSM service team member and part of the Jira-servicedesk-users group will be able to view the KB article titles through the JSM projects KB section.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In a JSM project. Have 3 Confluence KBs linked with the below permissions
 ** 2 KBs have private
 ** 1 KB has restricted
 # Have a an unlicensed Confluence user who:
 ** Is part of the +Jira-servicedesk-user+ group
 ** Is a +JSM Service Desk Team+ member for the JSM project
 ** Does not have Confluence Product Access
 # Make sure that the group +Jira-servicedesk-user+ has *view space permissions* on the above 3 Confluence KBS
 # In JSM project settings > Customer Permissions > Enable +Customers added by agents and admins+
 # As the unlicensed Confluence User. Navigate to the Project > Knowledge Base > It'll display the private KBs and the restricted KBs. 

h3. Expected Results

The user should *NOT*  able to view the private space Confluence Page Titles through the JSM projects KB articles.
h3. Actual Results

The user should *IS*  able to view the Confluence Page Titles through the JSM projects KB articles.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: JSM not respecting Confluence permissions when 3 KBs are linked to JSM project with different permissions

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Any page that has a table smaller than the full size of the screen would be shown occupying the whole width of the page. 

When in editor mode, the table is shown with the proper width size. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page with a table with width smaller than the page's.
 # Publish it
 # The page will show a table with its width filling the whole page. 
 # Click on edit
 # The table will be with the proper size.

h3. Expected Results

Tables should keep the size set by its creator.
h3. Actual Results

Tables aren't respecting the size set on the creation. 

 

h3. Workaround

Edit the page and resize the table should force the size setting.
fields.summary: Legacy editor doesn't keep the right width for tables

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When there is a page created with legacy editor and tables being added to the same, The text in the first column is very close to the table border.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # create a page with the legacy editor
 # Add a table.
 # update the content inside the table

h3. Expected Results

The content inside the table should be rendered normally.
h3. Actual Results

The text in the first column is very close to the table border defining as if it is being striked.
 !image-2021-08-26-16-17-15-077.png|thumbnail! 
  
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: First column of the table created in legacy editor is very close the content.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
App developers are not able to develop apps that provide the ability to export the content of a page as a PDF/Word export from the client side (browser).

Without this feature, a user using an app cannot control the dynamic content that is exported.

Processing the requests on the backend via the {{renderModes}}  also requires the code to be duplicated to be able to render the macro content in the front end as well as exporting it from the backend.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide a way to be able to export the content from the frontend.


h3. Workaround
Implement the export using the {{renderModes}} as described on the https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/modules/dynamic-content-macro page.
fields.summary: As an app developer, I want to be able to export the content to a PDF/Word file from the client/frontend so that I can provide a better and more reliable user experience

fields.description:
h3.Summary

When using the option to *Compare selected versions* from the [Page history feature|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/create-edit-and-publish-a-page/#Create-edit-andpublish-Pageversionsandhistorypage], if both versions do not have a difference, the result is generally a completely blank page.

h3.Suggestion

For users using this feature, having a blank page might seem like an issue since there are no messages or confirmation that the content has not changed.

This is a suggestion to provide a message when there are no differences between versions when using the "page history" feature.
fields.summary: Provide a message when comparing two versions without changes in the page history

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

After migrating data from another instance, certain images are not loading for Confluence pages, even though the images are correctly attached to the page and also available on media.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # We were able to reproduce this issue while migrating some Spaces.

h3. Expected Results

After Migration the attachments should be visible
h3. Actual Results

The images are not visible.
h3. Workaround

Engage Atlassian Support mentioning this ticket, so we can apply an internal workaround.
fields.summary: Fix the Save ADF Media Collection

fields.description:
h3.Summary

When the [Team calendars macro|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/use-team-calendars-for-confluence/] is added to a page, the loading time of it takes a few seconds until it is displayed, while all the rest of the page content is already loaded.

For calendars with a high number of events, it will also cause the events to be loader slowly until all the information is completely rendered.

h3.Suggestion

Aligned with the [performance improvements for Cloud|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Atlassian-Cloud-Migration/Confluence-Cloud-Performance-Improvements/ba-p/1669369], this is a suggestion to improve the performance for the team calendars macro.

A close workaround can be to [convert legacy pages to the current editor|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/convert-pages-to-the-new-editor/], which also has room for improvement in terms of performance for the Team Calendars macro.
fields.summary: Improve the loading for Team calendar macros

fields.description:
h3.Summary

In some scenarios where people want to check the use of sensitive content (I.E. password and credentials for existing users), a workaround can be to use the [Search results macro|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/insert-the-search-results-macro/] or a link with a current search, in which can be reviewed periodically to check if there are new keywords matching it in the search.

However, the process would be a manual one, meaning that the content would need to be checked manually, which could keep the sensitive data exposed for some time.

h3.Suggestion

This is a suggestion to have a security mechanism to trigger emails when specific keywords (selected by the admins) are added to pages or scenarios like the ones shared in the workarounds.

The mechanism would be like a macro that would have fields to allow specific words to be added to them and select which user should be notified.
fields.summary: Notification for sensitive content

fields.description:

use export to PDF and then print the exported file.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a long link is copy pasted in the confluence page the link is shortened automatically.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # create a link using the long URL in the confluence page
 # copy the same link and paste in the page

h3. Expected Results

Both the links should reflect the same URL
h3. Actual Results
{noformat}
The first link represents the full URL and the sopy pasted link represents the shortened URL.
{noformat}
h3. Workaround


 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: A long link copied and pasted within editor gets shortened

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When performing the "Get group members" API and paginating results, we'll get some duplicated users and some other users missing.
https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/rest/api-group-group/#api-wiki-rest-api-group-member-get

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Perform the following GET request (limit=5&start=0):
#* https://api.atlassian.com/ex/confluence/<site id>/wiki/rest/api/group/<group id>/membersByGroupId?limit=5&start=0
# Perform the following GET request (limit=5&start=5):
#* https://api.atlassian.com/ex/confluence/<site id>/wiki/rest/api/group/<group id>/membersByGroupId?limit=5&start=5
# Perform the following GET request (limit=5&start=10):
#* https://api.atlassian.com/ex/confluence/<site id>/wiki/rest/api/group/<group id>/membersByGroupId?limit=5&start=10
# Repeat until the number of users in the group.
# check the results


h3. Expected Results
Get the all member of the group correctly

h3. Actual Results
Some users are missing and some users are duplicated

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Duplicate and missing users in the results of "Get group members" API with pagination.
